00043 option options[] = {
00044   { "help", no_argument, NULL, 'h' },
00045   { }

00047 
00048 void usage(const BuildConfig& config) {
00049   fprintf(stderr,
00050 "usage: ninja [options] target\n"
00051 "\n"
00052 "options:\n"
00053 "  -f FILE  specify input build file [default=build.ninja]\n"
00054 "  -j N     run N jobs in parallel [default=%d]\n"
00055 "  -n       dry run (don't run commands but pretend they succeeded)\n"
00056 "  -v       show all command lines\n"
00057 "  -C DIR   change to DIR before doing anything else\n"
00058 "\n"
00059 "  -t TOOL  run a subtool.  tools are:\n"
00060 "             browse  browse dependency graph in a web browser\n"
00061 "             graph   output graphviz dot file for targets\n"
00062 "             query   show inputs/outputs for a path\n"
00063 "             targets list targets by their rule or depth in the DAG\n"
00064 "             rules   list all rules\n"
00065 "             clean   clean built files\n",
00066           config.parallelism);
00067 }
00068 
00069 int GuessParallelism() {
00070   int processors = 0;
00071 
00072 #if defined(linux)
00073   processors = get_nprocs();
00074 #elif defined(__APPLE__) || defined(__FreeBSD__)
00075   size_t processors_size = sizeof(processors);
00076   int name[] = {CTL_HW, HW_NCPU};
00077   if (sysctl(name, sizeof(name) / sizeof(int),
00078              &processors, &processors_size,
00079              NULL, 0) < 0) {
00080     processors = 1;
00081   }
00082 #elif defined(WIN32)
00083   SYSTEM_INFO info;
00084   GetSystemInfo(&info);
00085   processors = info.dwNumberOfProcessors;
00086 #endif
00087 
00088   switch (processors) {
00089   case 0:
00090   case 1:
00091     return 2;
00092   case 2:
00093     return 3;
00094   default:
00095     return processors + 2;
00096   }
00097 }

00099 /// An implementation of ManifestParser::FileReader that actually reads
00100 /// the file.
00101 struct RealFileReader : public ManifestParser::FileReader {
00102   bool ReadFile(const string& path, string* content, string* err) {
00103     return ::ReadFile(path, content, err) == 0;
00104   }
00105 };

00107 int CmdGraph(State* state, int argc, char* argv[]) {
00108   int status = 0;
00109   GraphViz graph;
00110   graph.Start();
00111   if (argc == 0) {
00112     string err;
00113     vector<Node*> root_nodes = state->RootNodes(&err);
00114     if (err.empty()) {
00115       for (vector<Node*>::const_iterator n = root_nodes.begin();
00116            n != root_nodes.end();
00117            ++n)
00118         graph.AddTarget(*n);
00119     } else {
00120       Error("%s", err.c_str());
00121       status = 1;
00122     }
00123   } else {
00124     for (int i = 0; i < argc; ++i) {
00125       Node* node = state->LookupNode(argv[i]);
00126       if (node)
00127         graph.AddTarget(node);
00128       else {
00129         Error("unknown target '%s'", argv[i]);
00130         status = 1;
00131       }
00132     }
00133   }
00134   graph.Finish();
00135   return status;
00136 }
00137 
00138 int CmdQuery(State* state, int argc, char* argv[]) {
00139   if (argc == 0) {
00140     Error("expected a target to query");
00141     return 1;
00142   }
00143   for (int i = 0; i < argc; ++i) {
00144     Node* node = state->GetNode(argv[i]);
00145     if (node) {
00146       printf("%s:\n", argv[i]);
00147       if (node->in_edge_) {
00148         printf("  input: %s\n", node->in_edge_->rule_->name_.c_str());
00149         for (vector<Node*>::iterator in = node->in_edge_->inputs_.begin();
00150              in != node->in_edge_->inputs_.end(); ++in) {
00151           printf("    %s\n", (*in)->file_->path_.c_str());
00152         }
00153       }
00154       for (vector<Edge*>::iterator edge = node->out_edges_.begin();
00155            edge != node->out_edges_.end(); ++edge) {
00156         printf("  output: %s\n", (*edge)->rule_->name_.c_str());
00157         for (vector<Node*>::iterator out = (*edge)->outputs_.begin();
00158              out != (*edge)->outputs_.end(); ++out) {
00159           printf("    %s\n", (*out)->file_->path_.c_str());
00160         }
00161       }
00162     } else {
00163       printf("%s unknown\n", argv[i]);
00164       return 1;
00165     }
00166   }
00167   return 0;
00168 }
00169 
00170 int CmdBrowse(State* state, int argc, char* argv[]) {
00171 #ifndef WIN32
00172   if (argc < 1) {
00173     Error("expected a target to browse");
00174     return 1;
00175   }
00176   RunBrowsePython(state, argv[0]);
00177 #else
00178   Error("browse mode not yet supported on Windows");
00179 #endif
00180   // If we get here, the browse failed.
00181   return 1;
00182 }
00183 
00184 int CmdTargetsList(const vector<Node*>& nodes, int depth, int indent) {
00185   for (vector<Node*>::const_iterator n = nodes.begin();
00186        n != nodes.end();
00187        ++n) {
00188     for (int i = 0; i < indent; ++i)
00189       printf("  ");
00190     const char* target = (*n)->file_->path_.c_str();
00191     if ((*n)->in_edge_) {
00192       printf("%s: %s\n", target, (*n)->in_edge_->rule_->name_.c_str());
00193       if (depth > 1 || depth <= 0)
00194         CmdTargetsList((*n)->in_edge_->inputs_, depth - 1, indent + 1);
00195     } else {
00196       printf("%s\n", target);
00197     }
00198   }
00199   return 0;
00200 }
00201 
00202 int CmdTargetsList(const vector<Node*>& nodes, int depth) {
00203   return CmdTargetsList(nodes, depth, 0);
00204 }
00205 
00206 int CmdTargetsSourceList(State* state) {
00207   for (vector<Edge*>::iterator e = state->edges_.begin();
00208        e != state->edges_.end();
00209        ++e)
00210     for (vector<Node*>::iterator inps = (*e)->inputs_.begin();
00211          inps != (*e)->inputs_.end();
00212          ++inps)
00213       if (!(*inps)->in_edge_)
00214         printf("%s\n", (*inps)->file_->path_.c_str());
00215   return 0;
00216 }
00217 
00218 int CmdTargetsList(State* state, const string& rule_name) {
00219   set<string> rules;
00220   // Gather the outputs.
00221   for (vector<Edge*>::iterator e = state->edges_.begin();
00222        e != state->edges_.end();
00223        ++e)
00224     if ((*e)->rule_->name_ == rule_name)
00225       for (vector<Node*>::iterator out_node = (*e)->outputs_.begin();
00226            out_node != (*e)->outputs_.end();
00227            ++out_node)
00228         rules.insert((*out_node)->file_->path_);
00229   // Print them.
00230   for (set<string>::const_iterator i = rules.begin();
00231        i != rules.end();
00232        ++i)
00233     printf("%s\n", (*i).c_str());
00234   return 0;
00235 }
00236 
00237 int CmdTargetsList(State* state) {
00238   for (vector<Edge*>::iterator e = state->edges_.begin();
00239        e != state->edges_.end();
00240        ++e)
00241     for (vector<Node*>::iterator out_node = (*e)->outputs_.begin();
00242          out_node != (*e)->outputs_.end();
00243          ++out_node)
00244       printf("%s: %s\n",
00245              (*out_node)->file_->path_.c_str(),
00246              (*e)->rule_->name_.c_str());
00247   return 0;
00248 }
00249 
00250 int CmdTargets(State* state, int argc, char* argv[]) {
00251   int depth = 1;
00252   if (argc >= 1) {
00253     string mode = argv[0];
00254     if (mode == "rule") {
00255       string rule;
00256       if (argc > 1)
00257         rule = argv[1];
00258       if (rule.empty())
00259         return CmdTargetsSourceList(state);
00260       else
00261         return CmdTargetsList(state, rule);
00262     } else if (mode == "depth") {
00263       if (argc > 1)
00264         depth = atoi(argv[1]);
00265     } else if (mode == "all") {
00266       return CmdTargetsList(state);
00267     } else {
00268       Error("unknown target tool mode '%s'", mode.c_str());
00269       return 1;
00270     }
00271   }
00272 
00273   string err;
00274   vector<Node*> root_nodes = state->RootNodes(&err);
00275   if (err.empty()) {
00276     return CmdTargetsList(root_nodes, depth);
00277   } else {
00278     Error("%s", err.c_str());
00279     return 1;
00280   }
00281 }
00282 
00283 int CmdRules(State* state, int argc, char* argv[]) {
00284   for (map<string, const Rule*>::iterator i = state->rules_.begin();
00285        i != state->rules_.end();
00286        ++i) {
00287     if (i->second->description_.unparsed_.empty())
00288       printf("%s\n", i->first.c_str());
00289     else
00290       printf("%s: %s\n",
00291              i->first.c_str(),
00292              i->second->description_.unparsed_.c_str());
00293   }
00294   return 0;
00295 }
00296 
00297 int CmdClean(State* state,
00298              int argc,
00299              char* argv[],
00300              const BuildConfig& config) {
00301   Cleaner cleaner(state, config);
00302   if (argc >= 1)
00303   {
00304     string mode = argv[0];
00305     if (mode == "target") {
00306       if (argc >= 2) {
00307         return cleaner.CleanTargets(argc - 1, &argv[1]);
00308       } else {
00309         Error("expected a target to clean");
00310         return 1;
00311       }
00312     } else if (mode == "rule") {
00313       if (argc >= 2) {
00314         return cleaner.CleanRules(argc - 1, &argv[1]);
00315       } else {
00316         Error("expected a rule to clean");
00317         return 1;
00318       }
00319     } else {
00320       return cleaner.CleanTargets(argc, argv);
00321     }
00322   }
00323   else {
00324     cleaner.CleanAll();
00325     return 0;
00326   }
00327 }
00328 
00329 int main(int argc, char** argv) {
00330   BuildConfig config;
00331   const char* input_file = "build.ninja";
00332   const char* working_dir = 0;
00333   string tool;
00334 
00335   config.parallelism = GuessParallelism();
00336 
00337   int opt;
00338   while ((opt = getopt_long(argc, argv, "f:hj:nt:vC:", options, NULL)) != -1) {
00339     switch (opt) {
00340       case 'f':
00341         input_file = optarg;
00342         break;
00343       case 'j':
00344         config.parallelism = atoi(optarg);
00345         break;
00346       case 'n':
00347         config.dry_run = true;
00348         break;
00349       case 'v':
00350         config.verbosity = BuildConfig::VERBOSE;
00351         break;
00352       case 't':
00353         tool = optarg;
00354         break;
00355       case 'C':
00356         working_dir = optarg;
00357         break;
00358       case 'h':
00359       default:
00360         usage(config);
00361         return 1;
00362     }
00363   }
00364   if (optind >= argc && tool.empty()) {
00365     Error("expected target to build");
00366     usage(config);
00367     return 1;
00368   }
00369   argv += optind;
00370   argc -= optind;
00371 
00372   if (working_dir) {
00373     if (chdir(working_dir) < 0) {
00374       Fatal("chdir to '%s' - %s", working_dir, strerror(errno));
00375     }
00376   }
00377 
00378   State state;
00379   RealFileReader file_reader;
00380   ManifestParser parser(&state, &file_reader);
00381   string err;
00382   if (!parser.Load(input_file, &err)) {
00383     Error("loading '%s': %s", input_file, err.c_str());
00384     return 1;
00385   }
00386 
00387   if (!tool.empty()) {
00388     if (tool == "graph")
00389       return CmdGraph(&state, argc, argv);
00390     if (tool == "query")
00391       return CmdQuery(&state, argc, argv);
00392     if (tool == "browse")
00393       return CmdBrowse(&state, argc, argv);
00394     if (tool == "targets")
00395       return CmdTargets(&state, argc, argv);
00396     if (tool == "rules")
00397       return CmdRules(&state, argc, argv);
00398     if (tool == "clean")
00399       return CmdClean(&state, argc, argv, config);
00400     Error("unknown tool '%s'", tool.c_str());
00401   }
00402 
00403   BuildLog build_log;
00404   build_log.SetConfig(&config);
00405   state.build_log_ = &build_log;
00406 
00407   const string build_dir = state.bindings_.LookupVariable("builddir");
00408   const char* kLogPath = ".ninja_log";
00409   string log_path = kLogPath;
00410   if (!build_dir.empty()) {
00411     if (mkdir(build_dir.c_str(), 0777) < 0 && errno != EEXIST) {
00412       Error("creating build directory %s: %s",
00413             build_dir.c_str(), strerror(errno));
00414       return 1;
00415     }
00416     log_path = build_dir + "/" + kLogPath;
00417   }
00418 
00419   if (!build_log.Load(log_path.c_str(), &err)) {
00420     Error("loading build log %s: %s",
00421           log_path.c_str(), err.c_str());
00422     return 1;
00423   }
00424 
00425   if (!build_log.OpenForWrite(log_path.c_str(), &err)) {
00426     Error("opening build log: %s", err.c_str());
00427     return 1;
00428   }
00429 
00430   Builder builder(&state, config);
00431   for (int i = 0; i < argc; ++i) {
00432     string path = argv[i];
00433     string err;
00434     if (!CanonicalizePath(&path, &err))
00435       Fatal("can't canonicalize '%s': %s", path.c_str(), err.c_str());
00436 
00437     if (!builder.AddTarget(path, &err)) {
00438       if (!err.empty()) {
00439         Error("%s", err.c_str());
00440         return 1;
00441       } else {
00442         // Added a target that is already up-to-date; not really
00443         // an error.
00444       }
00445     }
00446   }
00447 
00448   bool success = builder.Build(&err);
00449   if (!err.empty()) {
00450     printf("build stopped: %s.\n", err.c_str());
00451   }
00452 
00453   return success ? 0 : 1;
00454 }
